respStmt.resp: Conversion to TEI based on earlier work for the ENRICH project (enrich@oucs.ox.ac.uk; http://tei.oucs.ox.ac.uk/ENRICH/)

msDesc.head: Guardbook: miscellanous fragments, mainly of legal works

history.provenance: From the bindings of printed books and manuscripts unless stated otherwise

recordHist.source: Typescript description by Bodleian Library staff.

ref.title: MLGB3: Medieval Libraries of Great Britain

msItem.title: Will of Lucas de Empoli , near Florence, endorsed ‘1363’ in a later hand

msItem.author: Gratian
msItem.title: Decretum
msItem.note: I. tit.56.10 – 60.3 and 63.28 – 31 with glossa ordinaria

msItem.title: Decretals
msItem.note: I tit.18.6 – 21.5 and 30.6 – 31.8 with glossa ordinaria (N. R. Ker, Pastedowns in Oxford bindings no.1138 p.106)

msItem.author: Justinian
msItem.title: Digest
msItem.note: XVI tit.1.15–16, 18–19, 25–27 with Accursian gloss

msItem.author: Johannes Andreae
msItem.title: Nouellae in Decretales
msItem.rubric: Incipit novella Johannis Andree super sexto libro decretalium. Thome Chyllindene prioris secundum

supportDesc.extent: strip from top of a leaf

history.provenance: Thomas Chillenden (-1411), prior of Christ Church Canterbury.
Given by him to Christ Church, Canterbury: see M. R. James, Ancient libraries of Canterbury and Dover Cambridge, 1903 p. 150 no. 7

msItem.title: Commentary on Aristotle, Metaphysics
msItem.note: XI.4

msItem.author: Nicholas Trivet
msItem.title: Commentary on Boethius, De consolatione philosophiae

msItem.author: Hugutio
msItem.title: Derivationes
msItem.note: letter P

msItem.author: Aristotle
msItem.title: Ethics
msItem.note: III.7.1114b (paraphrase)

msItem.author: Justinian
msItem.title: Digest
msItem.note: XLIX tit.8.1 – 9.1 and 10.1 – 14.1, with Accursian gloss

msItem.author: Justinian
msItem.title: Digest
msItem.note: IV tit.3.7–11, 18–24, with Accursian gloss

msItem.title: Commentary on Digest
msItem.note: XXXVIII tit.9.10

msItem.author: Justinian
msItem.title: Codex
msItem.note: II tit.19.13–20, and 20.8 – 21.4 with Accursian gloss

origin.origDate: text 12th cent., with gloss added 13th–14th cent.

msItem.author: Justinian
msItem.title: Codex
msItem.note: XII tit.34.6 – 36.6 (the leaf should be reversed)

msItem.title: Chronicle of Saint-Pierre-le-Vif
msItem.note:
Formerly attributed to Clarius, monk of S.Pierre-le-Vif . Extracts; copied from a MS. in the monastery ‘Ex quo quidem antiquo croniquorum volumine magister Johannes Barre officialis Senon. curialis et in presenti libro pontificali transcribi fecit’ …‘anno domini
MoCCCCV die V. mensis Augusti’. There follow three extracts on St. Ursicinus from legendaries. For Clarius see D'Achery, Spicilegium II.466, 7. Last page blank.

msItem.rubric: Forma iuramenti seu professionis suffraganeorum Senonensium

msItem.title: Lollard tract against appropriations
msItem.note: (part), referring to a quarrel between Walden abbey and the rector of its church at Amersham

msItem.title: Legal opinion on piracy
msItem.note: in the hand of Patrick Young

msItem.author: Christopher Haryson
msItem.title: Poem
msItem.note: (for Haryson, B.A. Oxford 1651, see Foster, Alumni II.660)
msItem.incipit: En rursus liceat neglecta resumere plectra

history.provenance: On the verso in Gerard Langbaine's hand is the pressmark 125 and ‘1291 19o Ed.I taxatio Ecclesiarum Diocesis Lincolniensis magna ex parte’, it thus formed the wrapper of MS.Bodley Rolls 25 (S.C. 3114)

msItem.author: Justinian
msItem.title: Codex
msItem.note: VII tit.62.11–13, 16–18, 21–23 and 29, with Accursian gloss

msItem.title: Records of a court held in 1376
msItem.note: There are references to Neustadt, Thuringia

msItem.rubric: Memoriale pro agendis cum domino Cistercii vel capitulo generali
msItem.note: Concerning Spanish houses, with a list of ‘Monasteria vero super quorum nova taxacione debet ex parte omnium abbatum istarum parcium dno. Cistercii et capitulo generali supplicari’

msItem.author: J. Cusanus
msItem.title: Algorithmus linealis proiectilium
msItem.note: (transcript of the printed book [Vienna, 1514])

msItem.author: Justinian
msItem.title: Digest
msItem.note: XIX tit.2.32–51 with Accursian gloss

msItem.author: Ralph Bocking O.F.M.
msItem.title: Life of St.Richard of Chichester
msItem.note: end of prologue and beginning of text (Acta Sanctorum, Aprilis I p.285) , blank on the verso

msItem.title: Miracles of the Virgin
msItem.note: end of the ‘quinta particula’

msItem.title: Decretals
msItem.note: III.tit.30.26–30 and V tit.39.14–22, with glossa ordinaria and additional glosses

msItem.title: Formulary for an ecclesiastical court, probably in Southern France

msItem.author: Aristotle
msItem.title: Physics
msItem.note: end of bk.IV and beg. of bk.V, as pr. in the 1520 Lyons edition, fol.CLXII–CLXIX

msItem.title: Psalter (choir psalter)
msItem.note: Reject leaf from a choir psalter, Ps. 7.17 – 9.6

msItem.author: Raymundus de Pennaforti
msItem.title: Summa de penitentia
msItem.note: discontinuous portions of book III

msItem.author: Arator
msItem.title: Historia apostolica
msItem.note: II.230–256, with gloss
